meanings.definition: To give insufficient importance or attention to.
meanings.sent1: She tends to underemphasize the value of her own achievements.
meanings.sent2: It is not wise to underemphasize the importance of regular exercise.
meanings.sent3: He always underemphasizes his cooking skills, but everyone loves his dishes.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's strictness underemphasizes the warmth and care she shows her students.
meanings.sent5: Don't underemphasize the impact of small acts of kindness on others.

meanings.definition: To downplay or minimize the significance of.
meanings.sent1: The company tried to underemphasize the negative effects of their new product.
meanings.sent2: Politicians often underemphasize the challenges of implementing new policies.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to underemphasize his mistake only made it more obvious.
meanings.sent4: The artist's use of black and white colors underemphasizes the vibrancy of the scene.
meanings.sent5: Never underemphasize the power of a sincere apology.
